properties.areaDesc: Wilkin; Ransom; Norman; Cass; Clay; Sargent; Barnes; Richland
properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 3:51AM CST until January 16 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Grand Forks ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory,
very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below
zero.

* WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Minnesota and
southeast North Dakota.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today.
For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon today to 3 PM CST
Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
will impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind
chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10
minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at
dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling
5 1 1 in either state.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 3 PM CST THURSDAY
